adjective.description: Directed behind or to the rear.
examples: she left the room without a backward glance

adjective.description: Having made less than normal progress.

adverb.description: (of a movement) away from one's front; in the direction of one's back.
examples: Harry suddenly fell backward into a somersault
a loving look backward at his early life

phrases: he bent over backward to be fair to the defendants
she knows the language backward and forward
origin: Middle English: from earlier abackward, from aback.
